bibl.title: Notationes legentis. 23-30.

series.title: Bulletin of the American Society of Papyrologists
BASP

bibl.note: 23. P. Stras. 560 and the usurpation of military status. - 24. The most direct evidence for the statement that the term of office of the "katasporeus" is one year is in P. Mich. Inv. 2920 (= S.B. IV, 7361). - 25. Puts the dividing line between the two parts of P. Oxy. XXXVI, 2754 at line 8. - 26. "Selis" is a column of writing, not a sheet of papyrus. Another good example is now at hand: P. Amst. Inv. 23. - 27. New reading of line 9 of P. Oxy. XXII, 2342, which contains indirect evidence bearing on the time-table of the prefect's annual "conventus". - 28. New translation of lines 13-19 of P. Amst. Inv. 23. - 29. P. Col. 123 was probably made for official use or publication. Additional (if indirect) support for this view can be found in P. Yale 61. - 30. Comments on the book of: Giuliana Foti Talamanca, Ricerche sul processo nell'Egitto greco-romano. I. L'organizzazione del 'conventus' del 'praefectus Aegypti' (Milano, 1974).
